summary: The Mediterranean Sea is a large, almost landlocked sea connected to the Atlantic Ocean. It is surrounded by Europe, Africa, and Asia. This sea is very important in history, especially for ancient traders. It covers about 2.5 million square kilometers and has many islands, with Sicily and Sardinia being the largest. The Mediterranean is deep, with an average depth of 1,500 meters. It gets its name from the climate it creates, where winters are mild and summers are warm. Many countries, like Spain, Italy, Greece, and Egypt, have coastlines along this sea.
title: Mediterranean Sea
